title: 61-year-old Kerala doctor arrested in POCSO case for allegedly molesting teen during counselling
content: The incident occurred in December 2023 when the girl, now 16, visited the doctor’s house for counselling with her parents. She disclosed the abuse during a school counselling session this year

title: At SCO Defence Ministers’ meet in Qingdao, Rajnath likely to discuss regional peace, anti-terror cooperation
content: Rajnath Singh will hold bilateral meetings with the Defence Ministers of some participating countries, including China and Russia, on the sidelines of the meeting.

title: Student enrollment drop in Kota: Local economy struggles, coaching marketing intensifies
content: Kota’s student enrolments decline, impacting local businesses and prompting desperate marketing strategies.

title: India evacuates fresh batch of 292 Indians from Iran
content: A C-17 military transport aircraft of the Indian Air Force evacuated 165 Indians who were living in Israel. They were received at the airport by Union Minister L Murugan.

title: Telangana tops India in child labour rescues, arrests: Report
content: The report “Building the Case for Zero” calls for district-level child labour task forces, universal free and compulsory education up to the age of 18, and a zero-tolerance policy for the use of child labour in public procurement and supply chains

title: V.S. Achuthanandan remains in ICU, condition stable, says family
content: In a Facebook post, Achuthanandan’s son, V. Arun Kumar, says his father was admitted to the hospital on Monday after the centenarian experienced ‘mild’ breathing difficulties

content: Passengers are advised to check the latest status of their flights with their respective airlines before proceeding to the airport, says Kannur International Airport Limited

content: Court rules that nothing in the Act seemed arbitrary or a violation of the Constitution, as the Act clearly gives opportunities for the clinical establishments for a hearing before the authorities can take dire steps against a clinical establishment

content: During an event in Pune, Mr. Gadkari heaped praise on former bureaucrat Vijay Kelkar for his ‘flexibility in policy-making’

content: Linguist Ganesh Devy emphasised the need for unity among the Dravidian language-speaking States of the south to launch a collective resistance against Hindi imposition

content: The stage is set for electing a new mayor and a deputy mayor with the Regional Commissioner fixing June 30 as the date for elections

content: Responding to the allegation by Aland MLA B. R. Patil about corruption in allocation of houses, the Home Minister said that the government would order an inquiry if specific allegations are made

content: Having undergone severe mental duress, Mr. Farooq made a call to Dharmavaram Assembly constituency in-charge Harish Babu, who brought the issue to the attention of the Minister.

content: “Every man’s house is his castle or temple, the sanctity of which cannot be vilified by knocking on the door at odd hours”

title: Karnataka Lokayukta conducts raids across state, including BBMP and multiple town municipalities
content: The locations being raided are in Bengaluru, Shivamogga, Chikkamagaluru, Anekal, Gadag, Dharwad and Kalaburagi.

content: The mathematics teacher has been remanded in police custody for three days and suspended from service, they said.

title: Jagan was provided Z-plus security during Rentapalla tour, says A.P. Home Minister
content: The convoy death case is being dealt with as per law, and those responsible for it will be punished, says Anitha.

title: Four BJP MLAs suspended from West Bengal Assembly
content: They were suspended from the House due to disobedience towards the Speaker, for allegedly hitting microphones, and misconduct.

title: Delhi Police bust racket of illegal diversion of aviation turbine fuel
content: According to Delhi police, the security locks on the tankers that were meant to be opened only at the designated airport depot were then bypassed using a duplicate master key.

title: Heavy rains trigger landslide on Mata Vaishno Devi track; forces suspension of battery car service
content: The officials said the pilgrimage was diverted to the old route and was continuing without any disruption.

title: Despite letter from Union Ministry, DSEL yet to act against private school that allegedly denied admission to child suffering from ‘mild hyperactivity’
content: The management claimed that the school had not denied admission to the student, but rather the father had moved the child to another school

title: NAL transfers environment-friendly solar absorber coating technology to Mysuru startup
content: NALSUN-NG requires minimal investment in infrastructure, has no flammable components, and poses no effluent treatment challenges making it ideal for local manufacturing and rural deployment

title: New NBA mock draft, two days before Round 1: Latest buzz on the chaotic top-10 picks
content: Will the 76ers, Hornets and Jazz take best-player-available approaches? We project both rounds of the NBA draft.

title: Sources: Celtics trading Holiday to Trail Blazers
content: The Celtics are trading Jrue Holiday to the Trail Blazers for Anfernee Simons and two second-round draft picks, sources told ESPN on Monday night.

title: Haliburton on playing injured: 'I'd do it again'
content: Indiana Pacers star Tyrese Haliburton said he didn't regret playing through a calf strain that led to a torn right Achilles tendon in Game 7.

title: Padres' Tatis sues BLA to void future earnings deal
content: Padres star Fernando Tatis Jr. filed a lawsuit Monday against Big League Advance in an attempt to void the future earnings contract he signed as a 17-year-old minor leaguer that could cost him $34 million.

title: Raleigh hits MLB-leading 32nd HR in Mariners' win
content: Seattle star catcher Cal Raleigh, 28, hit his major-league-leading 32nd home run in the ninth inning of the Mariners' 11-2 victory over the Minnesota Twins on Monday night, just a few hours after being chosen the American League player of the week.

title: Sources: Mavs to extend Gafford on $60M deal
content: Dallas Mavericks center Daniel Gafford intends to sign a three-year contract extension worth nearly $60 million, sources told ESPN.

title: Miami's unbeaten run sets up CWC clash with PSG
content: Palmeiras came from behind to draw 2-2 with host Inter Miami at Hard Rock Stadium on Monday night, with both clubs advancing to the Club World Cup round of 16 and setting up a matchup between Miami and Paris Saint-Germain.

title: D-backs' Carroll headed to IL with wrist fracture
content: Arizona Diamondbacks manager Torey Lovullo told reporters, after his club's 10-0 victory over the Chicago White Sox on Monday night, that star outfielder Corbin Carroll has a chip fracture in his left wrist, and the veteran is headed to the injured list.

title: 'We are Vegas' team': A's begin building stadium
content: The A's on Monday celebrated the groundbreaking of their new $1.75 billion, 33,000-person capacity ballpark in Las Vegas that is expected to be finished in time for the 2028 season.

title: 🔁 Redrafting MLB draft top-10 picks, 2015-24
content: Witt over Rutschman? Does Skenes still go No. 1? Let's go back in time to right the wrongs of the past 10 MLB drafts.

title: Why this Thunder big 3 might be the one to start a dynasty
content: When the Thunder set out to build a champion, they learned hard lessons from how their historic trio of KD, Russell Westbrook and James Harden flamed out a decade ago.

title: How close is your team to an NBA title? We tiered all 30 franchises
content: While the world watched the Finals, the league's hierarchy shifted. Is OKC already looking over its shoulder ?

title: Club World Cup Daily: Messi's Miami book showdown with PSG
content: Leo Messi's Inter Miami have made it to the knockouts, where they'll face PSG, while Atletico are the first big team to go home early. Here's what you need to know from Monday's Club World Cup action.

title: Buzz: How Blackhawks, Isles, Predators could shake up first round
content: The first round is Friday. Our reporters pass along the latest intel they're hearing from around the league.

title: 5 things we've learned about the 'freaking awesome' NL West
content: The most dynamic division in baseball has been tons of fun so far. After 17 games in 18 days, here are five lessons.

title: Why 'treatment of families' matters to NFL players -- and where some teams fall short
content: From the Vikings (A+) to the Bengals (F-), we asked players what the expectations are in team treatment of their families.

title: Why empty seats litter Club World Cup, Gold Cup
content: Little more than a week into the summer of soccer, and some of the defining images of the Club World Cup and Gold Cup have been seas of empty seats.

title: Wrexham legend Paul Mullin leaves club on loan
content: Paul Mullin, the poster boy of a Wrexham team soaring through England's football leagues following their takeover by Hollywood celebrities, has left the club to join League One side Wigan on a season-long loan deal.

title: City's Lewis has CWC ban extended by 2 games
content: Rico Lewis will miss Manchester City's next two games at the Club World Cup after his ban was extended following his red card against Wydad AC.

title: Source: Barça close in on Roony Bardghji transfer
content: Barcelona are close to completing the signing of Copenhagen FC winger Roony Bardghji, a source has told ESPN.

title: Chelsea feel no pressure to win $130M CWC prize
content: Enzo Maresca said Chelsea are not under any financial pressure to lift the Club World Cup despite the £97million on offer to the winner.

title: Sources: Milan's Hernández nears Al Hilal move
content: Saudi Pro League club Al Hilal are in advanced negotiations with AC Milan to sign Theo Hernández for a fee close to €30 million ($34.6m), sources have told ESPN.

title: Poch awed by U.S. leader Tillman: 'What a player'
content: United States manager Mauricio Pochettino said he was pleased to see his team deliver a "professional performance" in defeating Haiti 2-1 in the Concacaf Gold Cup.

title: Jets owner Johnson agrees to buy Palace stake
content: New York Jets owner Woody Johnson has agreed on a £190 million deal ($254m) to buy a 43% stake in Premier League team Crystal Palace from American businessman John Textor, the club announced on Monday.

title: USMNT completes 'perfect' group stage that was anything but
content: Mauricio Pochettino's USMNT made it three-for-three in the Gold Cup group stage, but there is clearly plenty still to work on for the Americans.

title: Grading the deal: Houston goes all-in, but did Phoenix get enough?
content: The Suns and Rockets have agreed to a deal that lands Kevin Durant in Houston. Which side won the trade?

title: Whitcomb, Amihere lead top pickups this week
content: Sami Whitcomb and Laeticia Amihere are positioned to produce for their teams and fantasy managers ahead of a busy week in the WNBA.

title: 2025-26 NBA championship odds: Thunder open as faves ahead of Cavs, Knicks
content: Fresh off their first NBA championship, the Oklahoma City Thunder are favorites to repeat next season.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal join race to sign Madueke
content: Arsenal are reportedly looking to sign Chelsea's Noni Madueke. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Drake Maye marries longtime girlfriend Ann Michael Hudson
content: Maye and Hudson started dating in 2015, with the Patriots quarterback proposing to Hudson in January.

title: Waiver wire: Find someone like Jo Adell?
content: Todd Zola outlines the players you should be claiming off the waiver wire. Rumor has it you should be looking at the Angels outfield.

title: Kerala Opposition Leader seeks Centre’s intervention to ensure safety of Indians in Qatar
content: In letter to PM, V.D. Satheesan says a large number of Indian expatriates, particularly from Kerala, work across the Gulf countries

title: Three killed, 10 injured as lorry rams commuters at Lankelapalem Junction in Vizag
content: According to a police official, the lorry was heading towards Anakapalli from Gajuwaka, when it reportedly rammed into multiple vehicles at the busy junction.

title: Closure of airspaces: Passengers endure long ordeal at Kochi airport in Kerala amid flight disruptions
content: As of Tuesday morning, 17 services to and from Kochi airport stand cancelled. This includes services to Doha, Dubai, Abu Dhabi, Muscat, Ras al-Khaimah, Bahrain, Dammam, and Kuwait

title: India enters top 100 in global Sustainable Development Goals rankings for first time
content: India ranks 99th on the 2025 SDG Index with a score of 67, while China ranks 49th with 74.4 and the US 44th with 75.2 points.

title: Flight disruptions in Kerala to continue though airspaces in West Asia reopened
content: Additional seating arrangements for passengers and counters for airlines are being set up in Terminal 2 of the Thiruvananthapuram International Airport to handle the situation

title: Eluru man becomes Andhra Pradesh’s first para-swimmer to conquer English Channel, Palk Strait
content: Balaga Ganesh (38) was part of the ‘Pride of India – A Team’, a six-member relay team that successfully swam across the English Channel, covering a distance of 34 km from England to France in the Atlantic Ocean on June 16.

title: Indrakeeladri temple development gains momentum; master plan, land protection in focus
content: Efforts under way to secure Central support under the PRASAD scheme to boost Sri Kanaka Durga temple tourism infrastructure, says Endowments Minister

title: Ward Secretariat staff submit representations to Collector over promotions and transfers
content: Many employees in Ward Secretariats, who have completed five years of service and are eligible for promotion, have not been promoted so far, pointed out Subhani, who has completed six years of service.

title: Israel-Iran conflict: 16 flights cancelled to and from Bengaluru, five diverted
content: Airport sources said that the flights that were diverted to KIA departed after air space opened at 3 am.

title: Bombay Bar Association slams ED summons to senior advocates, warns of legal action
content: The Bombay Bar Association has strongly condemned the Enforcement Directorate for issuing summons to Senior Advocates Arvind Datar and Pratap Venugopal. Though the summons were later withdrawn, the Association called the move a serious threat to the independence of the legal profession.

title: Unemployed youth move Bombay High Court over delayed induction despite appointment letter
content: Sumedh Shivaji Jadhav, a qualified youth from Sindhudurg, has approached the Bombay High Court after being denied joining despite receiving a government-backed job appointment. His petition highlights bureaucratic inaction and seeks urgent redress for months of unemployment.

title: IIT Bombay scientists develop solar heat battery for freezing Himalayan homes
content: Researchers at IIT Bombay have developed a solar-powered thermochemical battery using strontium bromide that can store summer heat and release it in freezing Himalayan winters. The system offers a clean, cost-effective alternative to diesel heating in remote, high-altitude regions.

title: NCP demands stern action against Abu Azmi’s ‘wari‘ remark
content: The Nationalist Congress Party has condemned Samajwadi Party leader Abu Azmi’s remarks about ‘wari’ and called him a “toxic element” in the State who is repeatedly engaging in inflammatory statements to disrupt harmony.

title: Centre approves ₹10,637-crore road, tunnel projects for Kashmir
content: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari approves 19 road and tunnel projects worth ₹10,637-crore for Jammu and Kashmir, improving connectivity and infrastructure

title: TMC accuses Centre of not releasing funds for Ghatal flood management plan
content: The Ghatal Master Plan is a comprehensive flood management scheme by the West Bengal government, aimed particularly at flood-prone areas in Purba Medinipur and Paschim Medinipur

title: Deadline for exercising option under Unified Pension Scheme extended
content: The Finance Ministry extends UPS option exercise deadline to September 30, 2025 for government employees under National Pension System

title: ‘Beej Utsav’ highlights role of indigenous seeds in agricultural sustainability
content: Held in the tribal belt at the tri-junction of Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, and Gujarat, participants at the ‘seed festival’ were apprised of the significance of seed heritage, biodiversity, and climate consciousness

title: India slams OIC for ‘incorrect’ remarks that reflect ‘Pakistan’s influence’
content: The MEA said the OIC's repeated failure to acknowledge the documented threat of terrorism emanating from Pakistan reflects a wilful disregard for facts

title: Two J&K residents held for displaying U.S., Israel flags
content: A police spokesman said the two individuals were detained for installing foreign flags during night hours in an apparent attempt “to disturb public peace and order”

title: Kanishka bombing 1985 stresses need for zero tolerance to terrorism: Jaishankar
content: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri leads Indian team to Cork, Ireland where a solemn ceremony was held at Ahakista, to remember those who perished in the terror bombing that took place on June 23, 1985

title: Bring back woman deported to Pakistan: J&K High Court
content: Human rights are the most sacrosanct component of a human life, says Judge in a June 6 order; petitioner from Pakistan had been staying in Jammu for the past 38 years with her husband and two children

title: Final decision on three-language formula only after consulting all stakeholders, says CM Fadnavis
content: The consultation process should be conducted with all stakeholders, including Marathi language scholars, literary figures, and political leaders, says the State Government

title: GI application filed for Balanagar Custard Apple
content: The scientific documentation of the Balanagar Custard Apple’s unique agro-morphological characteristics shows how its cultivation in a non-commercial manner in areas that are not irrigated marks it out.

title: New excise licence fee notified in Karnataka, proposed hike rolled back by 50%
content: Earlier, the government had announced a new licence fee regime by doubling the fee, drawing the ire of stakeholders

title: Raja Raghuvanshi murder: Meghalaya Police arrest eighth accused from Gwalior for destruction of evidence
content: Lokendra Singh Tomar was arrested in Gwalior for allegedly concealing and destroying evidence; he is the owner of the apartment in Indore where Sonam Raghuvanshi, Raja’s wife had stayed following his murder

title: India, Pakistan extend airspace ban for each other till July 24
content: As per the NOTAM, Indian airspace will not be available for Pakistan-registered aircraft and aircraft operated, owned or leased by Pakistan airlines and operators, including military flights

title: Bag containing bullets create flutter in Srisailam
content: Workers, while cleaning the town, found a red bag containing the bullets lying adjacent to the road divider in front of Vasavi Guest House

title: Lack of funds has put Karnataka MLAs in a spot, Congress leaders feel
content: While Kagwad MLA Raju Kage threatens to quit his membership of the Assembly over the slow pace of works, Sagar MLA Belur Gopalakrishna seeks resignation of Housing Minister Zameer Ahmed Khan

title: Global politics dictated by realism and self-interest and not solidarity: V-P Jaideep Dhankhar
content: Speaking at the launch of a book written by senior RSS leader Ram Madhav, the Vice-President calls for a shift in India’s foreign policy imagination, says this is the right time to move beyond ‘romanticism’ and focus on economic and strategic strength

title: Trade unions question Railway Board’s decision to re-engage retired staff
content: Criticism comes after the Railway Board issued an order on June 20 empowering Divisional Railway Managers to appoint retired staff as volunteers in non-gazetted posts

title: Centre using technology to exclude vulnerable sections: Congress on face authentication for anganwadi beneficiaries
content: The Women and Child Development Ministry had directed all States and Union Territories (UTs) to implement a mandatory face recognition system for take-home ration distribution and child attendance monitoring at anganwadi centres

title: AAP wins Ludhiana bypoll in Punjab; political circles see it as a face-saving victory
content: Congress candidate and working president of the State unit in Punjab resigns in the aftermath of the results

title: A.P. seeing welfare, development under NDA rule, says Purandeswari
content: After five years of bad governance, the people in the State elected good government: BJP State president

title: Shashi Tharoor’s praise of PM Modi exposes Rahul Gandhi: BJP
content: Mr. Tharoor wrote in The Hindu that Modi’s ‘energy, dynamism and willingness to engage was a prime asset for India on the global stage’ and it deserved more backing

title: Diplomatic deja vu: Trump pulls off an India-Pakistan on Israel-Iran; ceasefire 'in effect'
content: US President Donald Trump unilaterally declared a ceasefire between Israel and Iran, a move that surprised even his own administration and the involved nations. Trump claimed both countries sought his intervention for peace. He outlined a detailed ceasefire plan on social media, complete with a timeline, despite ongoing missile exchanges.

title: Gulf tensions: Multiple flights disrupted across India; airlines issue alert
content: Flight operations at Delhi's IGI Airport faced major disruptions with 48 cancellations, impacting Air India and IndiGo significantly. Airports across India, including Ahmedabad, Thiruvananthapuram, and Mangaluru, experienced delays due to airspace restrictions over Qatar and the Gulf region. Cochin and Lucknow airports issued advisories amid heightened Middle East tensions following Iran's missile strike on U.S. bases in Qatar and Iraq.

title: MLC: US cricket's American dream is slowly, but surely, becoming real
content: Kieron Pollard reflects on cricket's burgeoning presence in the US, highlighting its transition from immigrant communities to packed stadiums. He emphasises the sport's unique appeal to American audiences, the growing commercial viability attracting major sponsors, and the development of a structured cricket system. Pollard expresses optimism about cricket's future in America, noting its evolution into a cultural phenomenon.

title: Stock market rally: Investors richer by Rs 5 lakh crore - top reasons
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, soared in trade on Tuesday after Donald Trump announced a ceasefire between Iran and Israel.

title: New US Visa rule: Visa applicants to change this setting on FB, Instagram
content: The US embassy in India has announced that applicants for F, M, and J non-immigrant visas must now make their social media accounts public. This new guideline aims to help U.S. officials verify the identity and eligibility of visa applicants during the security screening process. The embassy stated this change is necessary to facilitate vetting and establish admissibility under U.S.

title: Will PPF rate fall below 7%? Public Provident Fund rate could hit 50-year low
content: Will Public Provident Fund (PPF) rate fall below 7% for the first time in decades, influenced by the Gopinath Committee formula and fluctuating 10-year government bond yields? Despite the possibility of a rate cut, PPF remains an attractive investment due to its tax-free interest, especially compared to taxable bank deposits and capped Voluntary Provident Fund contributions.

title: IND vs ENG: Ashwin comments on Jaiswal's catching; wants Jadeja to step up
content: R. Ashwin defended Yashasvi Jaiswal's slip catching in England, citing the Dukes ball's difficulty and urging patience. He highlighted the ball's larger feel compared to SG and Kookaburra. Ashwin also suggested Indian pacers create rough patches for Ravindra Jadeja to exploit, drawing inspiration from how foreign teams aid their spinners. He emphasized the importance of spin for India's chances.

title: BJP alleges Rahul Gandhi on 'secret' foreign trip; Congress hits back
content: The Congress party defended Rahul Gandhi's trip to London for his niece's graduation after BJP's Amit Malviya criticized his frequent foreign travels and demanded transparency. Congress spokesperson Pawan Khera accused the PMO of dirty tricks, confirming Gandhi's attendance at Miraya Vadra's graduation.

title: 21,000-plus jobs at risk: India’s top electronics body to govt; Chinese curbs may...
content: China's restrictions on rare earth metal exports, particularly terbium and dysprosium, are threatening over 21,000 jobs in India's audio electronics industry. ELCINA reports that these curbs disrupt supply chains, forcing reliance on Chinese speaker module imports and endangering local component manufacturing. The industry body urges government intervention through dialogue, exemptions, and investment in domestic rare earth magnet production.

title: Raj dig uncovers 3,500-yr-old site: ASI traces riverbed; findings link it to Saraswati river
content: In the heart of Rajasthan's Deeg district, archaeologists from the ASI have stumbled upon an ancient palaeochannel that may connect to the legendary Saraswati river. Recent excavations in Bahaj village have revealed settlements dating back to 3500-1000 BC, showcasing relics from the Kushan, Magadha, and Sunga dynasties.

title: Iran-Israel conflict: Trump declares ceasefire 'now in effect'; warns against violations
content: Amidst the Iran-Israel conflict, Donald Trump declared a ceasefire, which Iran promptly denied. Despite the denial, Iran confirmed its military operations ceased at 4 am Tehran time, following missile strikes on a US base in Qatar in response to attacks on its nuclear facilities. Tensions remain high as Iran's Supreme Leader asserts the nation's resilience.

title: IND vs ENG: Pant reprimanded by ICC - why has he been punished?
content: Rishabh Pant has been reprimanded by the ICC for breaching the Code of Conduct during the Headingley Test against England. Pant showed dissent at an umpire's decision regarding the condition of the ball, leading to a demerit point on his record. Despite this incident, Pant had an outstanding batting performance, scoring two centuries in the match.

title: Elon Musk’s simple life: World’s richest says will never own 5 things
content: Elon Musk, despite his immense wealth, maintains a surprisingly minimalist lifestyle. He sold numerous properties, opting for a small Boxabl home and even crashing at friends' places. Musk once lived on $1 a day and famously crashed a McLaren, never replacing it, showcasing his detachment from luxury possessions and focus on his ventures.

title: 'Molested & beat me': Woman groped, assaulted near Bengaluru
content: In Bengaluru's outskirts, a 26-year-old woman faced sexual harassment and assault by a group, leading to public outrage after videos surfaced. Police detained John Richard and his father, Kanikya Swamy, following complaints from both sides. The incident occurred when John, allegedly intoxicated, accosted the woman with lewd comments, escalating into a physical assault.

title: S&P raises India’s GDP growth forecast to 6.5%, despite fragile global situation
content: S&P Global Ratings anticipates India's economy will grow 6.5% this fiscal year. This revision considers normal monsoon and lower crude oil prices. Global uncertainties and Middle East unrest pose risks.

title: Gold rate today: Prices drop below Rs 97,000 per 10 grams- what’s the outlook?
content: Gold prices plummeted on MCX after a reported ceasefire announcement between Iran and Israel, with August futures dropping by approximately 3% to Rs 96,422/10 grams. Silver also declined, while both metals had previously gained due to Middle East tensions.

title: Char Dham Yatra: Landslides wreak havoc on Badrinath routes
content: Tragedy struck Uttarakhand's Char Dham pilgrimage as landslides triggered by heavy rainfall claimed three lives and left one missing. On the Yamunotri route, falling boulders killed two pilgrims, while another remains missing. A separate incident on the Badrinath highway resulted in the death of a woman after a rock struck her car.

title: Donald Trump hits out at US Fed Chair Jerome Powell; calls him ‘dumb, hardheaded person’
content: US President Donald Trump has intensified his criticism of Fed Chairman Jerome Powell, labeling him 'incompetent' for not lowering interest rates. Despite economists' fears, inflation has remained subdued, even with Trump's tariffs.

title: Dwyane Wade’s daughter steals spotlight dancing in white lehanga
content: A delightful Instagram video of Kaavia James, daughter of Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union, has captured hearts globally. The six-year-old is seen joyfully dancing to the Bollywood hit “What Jhumka?” while dressed in a traditional white lehenga. The heartwarming clip, posted by her parents, celebrates cultural exploration and youthful exuberance.

title: IND vs ENG: 'You know what...,' Gavaskar reveals outlandish plans after Pant's century
content: Rishabh Pant etched his name in cricket history by scoring centuries in both innings of the first Test against England, becoming only the second wicketkeeper-batter to achieve this feat. Pant's new eye-pointing celebration replaced his trademark somersault, drawing questions from commentators. His performance, along with KL Rahul's century, set England a target of 371.

title: 'She’s heartbroken': Blake Lively breaks down as Taylor Swift cuts ties
content: The friendship between Blake Lively and Taylor Swift has ended. Sources say Lively is heartbroken after Swift cut ties. Legal issues involving Justin Baldoni's case add complexity. Lively must submit texts with Swift. Rumors suggest Lively tried to leverage her Swift connection. Travis Kelce supports Swift during this difficult time. Swift's upcoming album may reflect themes of betrayal.

title: Moments after attack: Scenes of panic unfold in Doha mall after Iranian missile strikes - watch
content: Iran retaliated against US forces at Al Udeid Airbase in Qatar. This followed US strikes on Iranian nuclear sites. Explosions occurred in Doha and Lusail. Qatar closed its airspace. Iran claimed it targeted areas away from Qatari cities. Strikes also hit US bases in Iraq. These events followed Israeli strikes on Iranian nuclear facilities.

title: Health scare mid-air: 11 fall ill on Air India London-Mumbai flight; food poisoning suspected
content: An Air India flight AI-130 from London to Mumbai faced a mid-air scare as several passengers and crew members reported feeling dizzy and nauseated. While initial reports suggested 11 were affected, Air India confirmed that five passengers and two crew members experienced discomfort.

title: Himachal Pradesh school teacher arrested for sexually harassing 24 girls; touched students inappropriately
content: In Himachal Pradesh's Sirmaur district, a government school teacher has been arrested following allegations of sexually harassing 24 girl students. The accused, a mathematics teacher, was taken into custody after the students reported the incidents. Promptly, the education department suspended him, initiating an inquiry. A women’s rights group protested, highlighting increasing sexual assault cases involving teachers.

title: Woman finds 2.69 carat diamond; mining office awaits auction
content: After two years of relentless searching, a financially struggling woman discovered a 2.69-carat diamond in a private mine located in the Panna district. She has deposited the precious gem with the local mining office, initiating the standard auction process. Following the auction, she will receive the proceeds after deductions for royalty and taxes, marking a significant turn in her fortunes.

title: Iran-Israel conflict: Govt says airlines compelled to cancel or reroute flights
content: Due to escalating Middle East tensions and airspace closures, Indian carriers are canceling or rerouting flights, according to Union Minister Ram Mohan Naidu. The Ministry of Civil Aviation is closely monitoring the situation and coordinating with airlines to minimize passenger disruption. IndiGo has suspended flights to several Middle Eastern destinations, while Emirates rerouted flights on June 23.

title: IND vs ENG Test: 'It is hard for us to understand...,' KL Rahul on Pant
content: KL Rahul has defended Rishabh Pant's aggressive batting style after his remarkable performance in the first Test against England, where he became the first Indian wicketkeeper to score two centuries in a match. Pant's aggressive innings helped India set a target of 371 for England.

title: Trump makes new claim on ceasefire; Tehran says he 'begged for it'
content: Donald Trump asserted that Israel and Iran approached him seeking peace "almost simultaneously." This declaration followed his announcement of a U.S.-proposed ceasefire accepted by both nations to end their recent conflict. Trump expressed optimism for their future, envisioning "tremendous love, peace and prosperity" if they maintain a path of "RIGHTEOUSNESS & TRUTH."

title: 'Fight against violent extremism': Canadian PM Carney on Air India Kanishka bombing
content: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney marked the 40th anniversary of the Air India Flight 182 bombing, calling it Canada's deadliest terrorist attack. He reaffirmed Canada's commitment to fighting terrorism, echoing sentiments shared by opposition leader Pierre Poilievre. A memorial event in Ireland saw participation from Canadian, Indian, and Irish officials, emphasizing the need for international cooperation against terrorism.

title: Axiom-4: Nasa shares update; India's Shubhanshu Shukla targets liftoff tomorrow
content: Nasa has confirmed that the Axiom Mission 4 (Ax-4) to the International Space Station is now scheduled for launch on June 25, following earlier delays. Indian Air Force pilot Shubhanshu Shukla, representing Isro, will be the mission pilot, making him the second Indian in space after Rakesh Sharma. He will be accompanied by astronauts from Poland and Hungary.

title: Adani raises $1 billion for Mumbai Airport expansion from global investors
content: Adani Airports Holdings Ltd. (AAHL) has secured $1 billion in financing for Mumbai International Airport (MIAL) through a project finance structure. This includes issuing $750 million in notes for refinancing and a provision to raise an additional $250 million. The funds will support MIAL's capital expenditure program for development and modernization.

title: IND vs ENG: Pant equals Sachin's record, now only behind Rahul Dravid
content: Rishabh Pant made twin centuries at Headingley Test. He became the first Indian to score centuries in both innings of a Test in England. Pant joined India’s twin centuries club. His consistency in England earned him a special place. Pant equalled the record for the most sixes in a Test in England. The Headingley Test was historic for India.

title: 'He bowled to me in the nets': Tendulkar’s emotional tribute to Dilip Doshi will leave you teary-eyed
content: Former India left-arm spinner Dilip Doshi passed away in London at the age of 77 due to cardiac arrest. Sachin Tendulkar paid tribute, recalling their first meeting in 1990. Doshi played 33 Tests, taking 114 wickets, and was a stalwart in English county cricket, also representing Bengal and Saurashtra in the domestic circuit.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Straight ball hai, theke?';Pant’s self-check moment - Watch
content: Rishabh Pant dazzled in the first Test against England, showcasing his audacious talent. He scored a masterful century in each innings, becoming the first Indian to achieve this feat in England. Pant's innovative shots and candid self-talk, captured by stump mics, entertained fans.

title: IND vs ENG: My Test avg hurts, but I don’t chase numbers now'- KL Rahul
content: Rahul's magnificent century, his sixth in SENA countries, combined with a crucial partnership with Rishabh Pant, propelled India to a commanding position in the opening Test against England. India set a daunting target of 371, fueled by strong batting performances throughout the innings.

title: Israel-Iran conflict: Indigo issues travel advisory; says 'considering safest flight paths'
content: Following escalating tensions in the Middle East, Indigo has issued a travel advisory, suspending flights to and from several destinations including Dubai, Doha, and Riyadh until at least 1000 hours. The airline is closely monitoring the situation and considering the safest flight paths, prioritizing passenger safety amidst regional unrest.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock market recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Mirae Asset Sharekhan's Somil Mehta recommends buying Bharat Forge and National Aluminum. Bharat Forge, exhibiting a breakout from a consolidation pattern, is expected to continue its uptrend with targets at Rs 1350. Similarly, National Aluminum has broken out of a bullish flag pattern, projecting an upward movement towards Rs 215.

title: US judge blocks Trump's order on Harvard - What it means for foreign students
content: In a victory for Harvard University, a US federal judge has issued a second injunction against the Trump administration's efforts to restrict international students. The ruling allows foreign students to continue their studies in the US, despite the administration's attempts to pressure Harvard over its policies.

title: ‘Censored before release?’: Diljit reacts to row over Hania Aamir casting
content: Diljit Dosanjh's cryptic Instagram post, "Censored before release?" sparks speculation about his film 'Punjab 95', which faces censorship hurdles regarding its portrayal of human rights activist Jaswant Singh Khalra's life. Simultaneously, 'Sardaar Ji 3' bypasses Indian theaters due to backlash over casting Pakistani actress Hania Aamir amidst India-Pakistan tensions, highlighting ongoing debates about cross-border collaborations in the film industry.

title: Meerut: 13-year-old dalit patient raped at top govt hospital; sparks security concern
content: A 13-year-old Dalit girl, admitted for knock knees at a Meerut hospital, was allegedly sexually assaulted in the women's washroom by a 20-year-old attendant. The accused, Rohit Kumar, was arrested after the girl's mother filed a complaint.

title: ‘Sitaare Zameen Par’ Box Office collection day 4: Aamir Khan’s film nears Rs 70 crore mark in India
content: Aamir Khan's 'Sitaare Zameen Par' had a strong opening weekend, grossing Rs 66.65 crore in four days, despite a Monday dip. The film has already surpassed the lifetime collection of Aamir's previous film 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. Genelia Deshmukh also celebrates a career milestone as the film becomes her highest-grossing movie, exceeding 'Jaane Tu... Ya Jaane Na'.

title: Everyone Claims Victory: Ceasefire On, What Have US, Iran, Israel Gained
content: The ceasefire between Iran and Israel, which brought an end to the 12-day conflict, has relieved the world

title: "Ceasefire Now In Effect. Don't Violate It": Trump's Message After Iran's Move
content: US President Donald Trump on Tuesday said that the ceasefire agreement between Israel and Iran has not come into effect. The American leader also warned the two arch enemies in the Middle East not to violate the truce deal.

title: Opinion: Opinion | US, Iran And A Night Of Missiles And Fragile Messages
content: Trump's ceasefire declaration signals that the US does not seek further entanglement. Whether that message holds beyond a social media post remains to be seen.

title: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge Urges Global Peace Amid Iran-Israel Tensions
content: Amid the escalating tensions between Iran and Israel, Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge on Monday stressed the need for global peace and called on all nations to refrain from interfering in the affairs of "sovereign and democratic" countries.

title: "India Knows Value Of Peace": Gautam Adani Praises Operation Sindoor
content: Adani Group ChairmanGautam Adani on Tuesday praised the Indian armed forces for Operation Sindoor, which was launched last month to target terror sites in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK).

title: Rahul Gandhi Has Gone To London For Niece's Graduation, Says Congress
content: The Congress on Tuesday hit out at the BJP after it raised questions over Rahul Gandhi's foreign trip and clarified that he has gone to London to attend the graduation ceremony of his niece and will be back shortly.

title: Iran May Have More Underground Nuclear Sites For Uranium Enrichment: Report
content: An expert previously identified a new underground complex south of Natanz, which he says could be converted into a fully operational enrichment facility.

title: "We Don't Just Build Businesses, We Build India's Capabilities": Gautam Adani
content: Gautam Adani, the Chairman of the Adani Group, addresses the Adani Enterprises' Annual General Meeting (AGM).

title: Trump Expects Israel-Iran Ceasefire To Last "Forever" As Attacks Continue
content: US President Donald Trump on Monday night announced a truce deal between Israel and Iran, even as the two arch enemies continued exchanging salvoes for the 12th straight day.

title: Light Rain, Cloudy Skies To Bring Relief In Delhi-NCR Today
content: Several parts of the national capital and adjoining NCR areas are set to witness light rainfall and cloudy skies on Tuesday, bringing much-needed relief from the intense summer heat. Heavy showers expected across multiple Indian regions.

title: Iran Says "Ending Hostilities" After Barrage Of Missiles Kills 7 In Israel
content: The Iranian state-run media said that the ceasefire with Israel came into effect following five waves of Iranian attacks on Israeli-occupied territories.

title: Tesla Robotaxi A Menace On Road? Caught Speeding, Driving In Wrong Lane
content: A video showed a Tesla robotaxi reaching 35 miles per hour shortly after passing a 30 miles per hour speed limit sign.

title: Aviation Turbine Fuel Smuggling Racket Busted In Delhi, 6 Arrested
content: The Delhi Police on Monday claimed to have busted a racket siphoning off aviation turbine fuel from tankers and selling those in open market as a mineral turpentine oil, monthly loss costing Rs 1.62 Crore.

title: 28 Flights To Delhi Cancelled Amid Israel-Iran Tensions
content: As many as 48 flights - 28 arriving at Delhi airport and 20 departing from the capital - have been cancelled.

title: Israel-Iran War LIVE Updates: Iran Says “Ceasefire For Now” After Launching Multiple Missiles At Israel
content: US-Israel-Iran Conflict LIVE Updates: A series of powerful explosions rocked Tehran early Tuesday morning, hours after US President Donald Trump announced that Iran and Israel have agreed to a staggered ceasefire.

title: "You Have 12 Hours": Israeli Agent Threatens Iranian General In Leaked Audio
content: Israeli intelligence agents warned top Iranian generals earlier this month that they had "12 hours" to flee with their families or get killed, according to an audio recording obtained by The Washington Post.

title: 4 Air Sirens In 1 Hour In Tel Aviv As Iran Rains Missiles: Ground Report
content: The missile strikes come shortly after Iran hinted at a peace deal - which US President Donald Trump claimed a "complete and total" ceasefire between the two longtime enemies.

title: Sensex Jumps 750 Points After Trump Announces Israel-Iran Ceasefire
content: Indian equities opened higher on Tuesday after US President Donald Trump announced a ceasefire agreement between Iran and Israel.

title: NASA Says Launch Of Shubhanshu Shukla's Axiom Space Mission Likely Tomorrow
content: After repeated delays,NASA has now announced that Indian Astronaut Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla could fly to space tomorrow.

title: Himachal School Teacher Arrested For Allegedly Sexually Harassing 24 Students
content: The students gave a written complaint, alleging they were touched inappropriately by the school mathematics educator.

content: Dana White announces Jon Jones' retirement from the UFC . he declares Tom Aspinall the new heavyweight champion . "Jon Jones called us last night and retired," he tells a group of reporters . the 37-year-old has retired from mixed martial arts .

title: LSU wears crown as college baseball's premier program
content: the LSU Tigers beat Coastal Carolina with a big double play to take home the men's college world series . the title they really won was that of Greatest Ever College Baseball Program . "when we go to work every day, we do it trying to make the Tigers that came before us proud," says a designated hitter .

title: Chelsea need 'Cold' Palmer's tepid form to improve
content: Steve Nicol breaks down Cole Palmer's performance at the club world cup . the 23-year-old is still coming to terms with a level of profile . he says it has been quick in terms of how fast it has happened .

title: Grading the Flyers, Ducks on the Trevor Zegras trade
content: the Anaheim Ducks traded Trevor Zegras to the Philadelphia Flyers . he is a two-time 20-goal scorer who has also authored a pair of consecutive 60-point seasons . the Flyers finished 24th in goals per game .

title: Fantasy: How Haliburton's injury impacts Pacers
content: the Pacers could see the biggest shift in fantasy value for 2025-26 . in eight games without Haliburton this past season, Nembhard averaged 11.3 points, 2.6 rebounds and 6.6 assists . his 28.9 minutes per game in 2024-25 was a career high for the third-year pro out of Gonzaga .
